jsx.ui.vect.draw
Class Draw

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.vect.Graphic
                      jsx.ui.vect.draw.Draw
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnDragMove, OnDragStart, OnDragStop, OnRender, OnStyle
Direct Known Subclasses:
Line, Paint, Sketch
public abstract class Draw
extends Graphic
implements OnDragStart, OnDragMove, OnDragStop

An abstract base class for drawing tools that can interactively draw vector graphics.

A vector graphics drawing tool wraps either a VML component for IE or a SVG component for other browsers and draws a specific type of shapes in accordance with the Mouse handle to which it listens mouse events, eliminating the browser dependencies.

A Draw widget is Configurable and is also an event source which may fire high level events.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Field Detail

MOUSE

protected static final Id<Mouse> MOUSE

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draw object.

The identified configurable property of a Draw widget refers to its Mouse handle to which the widget listens mouse events.

Since:
1.0

START

protected static final Id<Position<?>> START

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draw object.

The identified configurable property of a Draw widget caches the latest mouse press event that occurs on the canvas. This property also tells whether the vector graphic widget is in a drawing mode.

Since:
1.0

X

protected static final Id<java.lang.Integer> X

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draw object.

The identified configurable property of a Draw widget caches the X coordinate of the left-corner of its underlying graphic component.

Since:
1.0

Y

protected static final Id<java.lang.Integer> Y

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draw object.

The identified configurable property of a Draw widget caches the Y coordinate of the left-corner of its underlying graphic component.

Since:
1.0
Constructor Detail

Draw

protected Draw()

The default constructor that constructs a wrapper widget of this type.

This constructor invokes the default constructor of the superclass to create a default underlying graphic component.

Since:
1.0
Method Detail

getMouse

public final Mouse getMouse()

Gets the mouse handle currently attached to this vector drawing wrapper.

This method simply returns the configurable property MOUSE of this wrapper widget.

Returns:
The mouse widget attached to this vector drawing tool.
Since:
1.0

attach

public final void attach(Mouse h)

Attaches a specified mouse handle to the vector drawing widget.

This method detaches the old mouse handle if there is one and attaches the specified one to the current drawing widget enabling it to listen the necessary types of mouse events from the mouse handle. Call this method from event listeners with caution.

Parameters:
h - The new mouse widget to be attached to the vector drawing tool.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
detach()

detach

public final void detach()

Detaches the current mouse handle from the vector drawing widget.

This method removes the mouse handle currently attached to the drawing widget and unregisters it as an event listener from the mouse widget with all event types. Call the method from event listeners with caution.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
attach(Mouse)

line

protected static final Component line(Draw d,
                                      Position<?> p1,
                                      Position<?> p2)

Draws a line with the two specified positions.

This method draws a line from a position computed with the first specified mouse Position data and the position data cached by the specified vector drawing tool to that computed with the second argument position.

A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
d - A vector drawing wrapper.
p1 - A mouse position event.
p2 - A mouse position event.
Since:
1.0

lineTo

protected static final void lineTo(Draw d,
                                   Component v,
                                   Position<?> p)

Draws a line with the specified position.

This method draws a line from the current position of a specified graphic Component to a new position computed with the specified mouse Position data and the position data cached by the specified vector drawing tool.

A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
d - A vector drawing wrapper.
v - The graphic component wrapped by the specified vector drawing tool.
p - A mouse position event.
Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(DragStart evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method enters the drawing mode and initializes the vector drawing tool and the internal caches.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnDragStart
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0
